intro: Hesperis verna, commonly known as the spring flowering candytuft, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its clustered, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, oval-shaped green pods that contain seeds. Its foliage consists of basal rosettes of linear, hairy leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Hesperis verna is often cultivated in gardens for its early spring blooms and its ability to attract pollinators.
